item.title: Trade Me-1-API testing first demo
item.description:
Foreword

Why I write this series? Three reasons.

  • 1st, the background is the author was in the process of seeking testing job in New Zealand. To pick a proper product and use the main stream testing tools to cover the manual testing, API automation testing, UI automation testing, and CICD will be a smart work for the author to show what his ability.
  • 2nd, the author found that too many testing engineers surrounding him expressed the desire to learn some automated testing techniques. But they don’t know what’s the roadmap to extend their testing technique stack, where to start with, and how to practice such comprehensive skills in as little time as possible? So, the author thought that such a series might help himself meanwhile to help those people who have the above questions in mind.
  • 3rd, the author wants to use this platform to get instant feedback to correct his own misconceptions about IT technologies, ultimately improving IT knowledge accumulation efficiency for both author and learner.

item.title: Trade Me-2-typical transactions
item.description:
How to pick the typical transactions?

Before coding the API test script, we need to pick some typical transactions from TradeMe.

And these transactions we’ve picked better to cover different types of requests, such as the get, post, delete.

And part of these transactions should correlate with each other at the business level.

item.title: How to install Git Bash?
item.description:
Git is a set of command line utility programs that are designed to execute on a Unix style command-line environment.

Git Bash is an application for Microsoft Windows environments which provides an emulation layer for a Git command line experience.

item.title: Difference between alpha and beta testing?
item.description:
• Alpha testing is performed in the controlled developing environment by real users but not internal developers or testers. It is often going after finishing a module or the whole system.

    Beta testing is performed in the uncontrolled external environment by real users. It is often going after the stable version of Alpha testing…

item.title: How do you determine priority and severity of a defect?
item.description:
Severity indicates the degree of damage defects impact to quality.Priority indicates the order to fix defects.

Severity and priority as two crucial aspects to defects; have some distinctions and connections.

In general, high severity often with high priority, but that is not exactly one-to-one correspondence…

item.title: What is STLC?
item.description: Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC) refers to a testing process which has specific steps to be executed in a definite sequence to ensure that the quality goals have been met. In the STLC process, each activity is carried out in a planned and systematic way. Each phase has different goals and deliverables. the STLC methodology focuses on the following phases of software development…

item.title: Why do we need a separate test environment?
item.description:
The typical classification of environment for IT products is as below. Separate environments will make sure different roles using their own environment. To focus on different test purposes.

Also, will do their test work parallelly, improve efficiency, reduce disturbance from each other…

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Who Am I

  • 10+ years old testing veteran. Expertise in performance testing, automation testing, knowledge sharing, and testing team-building.
  • Big love delicious food, karaoke, NBA games, and Hollywood blockbuster!
  • My favourite singers: Michael Jackson, Whitney Houston, Mariah Carey.
  • My favourite movie stars: Tom Hanks, Anthony Hopkins.
  • My favourite sports stars: Mike Jordan, Kobe Bryant, Stephen Curry, Ronaldo.
